data.title: Learn through games
data.description: Learning platform with simple games and the ability to receive scholarships paid in cryptocurrency.
data.problem: People need to learn, but some learning lessons are too expensive, or don't have quality content, or are boring.
data.solution: A platform with good lessons, simple games to test the progress, some free lessons, some lessons for payment with crypto and some lessons with scholarship paid with crypto.
data.missionSummary: Helping to make learning good, enjoyable and affordable.
data.locationOfImpact: Global but initial focus for scolarships in Sierra Leone, Africa.
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.description:
Learning platform with simple games and the ability to receive scholarships paid in cryptocurrency.

## Project Description

We propose to enhance https://learn.tg through (1) GoodDollar facial verification, (2) a KYC (know your customer) system, (3) a token and referral reward system, (4) a lesson on GoodDollar, token rewards, and the referral system, (5) scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population, and a marketing campaign.

## Technical Implementation

1. Open source the existing code with the backend in Ruby on Rails, the frontend in Vue, and self-managed wallet management.
2. Rewrite the application as an open-source web application in next.js or expo with React, wagmi, and rainbowkit.
3. Integrate GoodDollar facial verification
4. Store KYC data in the backend database
5. Implement the token and referral reward system from https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/
7. Lesson on GoodDollar, stablecoin conversion, and the referral reward system
8. Additional scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population
9. Sierra Leone-focused marketing campaign

## Team Capacity

* We have extensive experience in software development, as can be seen at https://github.com/vtamara
* We were one of the 2022 TON Prize winners for migrating TON blockchain tools to adJ https://t.me/tondev_eng/26429
* We received funding from the "Avalanche Community Grants" Quadratic Funding Round 1 to enhance the security of the Avalanche network by auditing, migrating, and testing Its core tools in OpenBSD/adJ. https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/43114/4/28

## Roadmap and Milestones

* Milestone 1. 2 months. Rewrite the application as an open-source web app in next.js or expo with React, Wagmi, and RainbowKit
* Milestone 2. 20 days. Integrate GoodDollar facial verification
* Milestone 3. 20 days. Implement token rewards (GoodDollars) and the referral system from https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/
* Milestone 4. 20 days. Create a lesson about GoodDollar, stablecoin exchange, token rewards, and the referral system.
* Milestone 5. 2 months. Implement additional scholarships and a marketing campaign focused on that country


## User Adoption Strategy

To attract users, we included:
* A rewards and referral system
* Additional scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population
* A marketing campaign focused on Sierra Leone

## Funding Allocation

* Milestone 1. 3600
* Milestone 2. 1200
* Milestone 3. 1200
* Milestone 4. 1200
* Milestone 5. 1700


## Ecosystem Contribution

We are not aware of any learning platform with a course on (1) GoodDollar, (2) conversion to stablecoins, and (3) with rewards, a referral system, and scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population.

## Ethical Compliance
Yes

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
1. We will open source this project as a result of this funding round. From a technicla perspective it is built with a backend wity Ruby on Rails, a front end with Vue and our own connection to the wallet.
2.  To advance faster we will rewrite the application on a different stack and open source it from the beginning.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
* The backend already allows a teacher to organize courses into chapters and guides.
* Each guide is written in Markdown.
* When a student connects with a wallet he/she sees more courses.
* We want to evaluate each guide with questions (open and multiple choice) but that can be answered through simple games.
* We will add lessons about crypto to invite new people to use crypto and save, specially people from Sierra Leone, Africa.
* We want to offer scolarships to people in Sierra Leone that will be paid as they advance in the lessons.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
1. We plan to re-write the application on next.js and/or on  expo, usign standard controls of wagmi and rainbowkit.

2. Store KYC data in the backend database

3. Implement the token and referral reward system from https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/

4. Lesson about crypto for people of Sierra Leone

5. Scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population and marketing campaign.

questions.query: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption
questions.explanation: Enhance https://learn.tg through (1) GoodDollar facial verification, (2) a KYC (know your customer) system, (3) a token and referral reward system, (4) a lesson on GoodDollar, token rewards, and the referral system, (5) scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population, and a marketing campaign.

questions.query: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.
questions.explanation:
1. Open source the existing code with the backend in Ruby on Rails, the frontend in Vue, and self-managed wallet management.
2. Rewrite the application as an open-source web application in next.js or expo with React, wagmi, and rainbowkit.
3. Integrate GoodDollar facial verification
4. Store KYC data in the backend database
5. Implement the token and referral reward system from https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/
6. Lesson on GoodDollar, stablecoin conversion, and the referral reward system
7. Additional scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population
8. Sierra Leone-focused marketing campaign

questions.query: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.
questions.explanation:
* We have extensive experience in software development, as can be seen at https://github.com/vtamara
* We were one of the 2022 TON Prize winners for migrating TON blockchain tools to adJ https://t.me/tondev_eng/26429
* We received funding from the "Avalanche Community Grants" Quadratic Funding Round 1 to enhance the security of the Avalanche network by auditing, migrating, and testing Its core tools in OpenBSD/adJ. https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/43114/4/28

questions.query: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
* **Milestone 1.** 2 months. Rewrite the application as an open-source web app in next.js or expo with React, Wagmi, and RainbowKit
* **Milestone 2.** 30 days. Integrate GoodDollar facial verification and/or KYC
* **Milestone 3.** 20 days. Implement token rewards (GoodDollars) and the referral system from https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/
* **Milestone 4.** 20 days. Create a lesson about GoodDollar, stablecoin exchange, token rewards, and the referral system.
* **Milestone 5.** 2 months. Implement additional scholarships and a marketing campaign focused on that country

questions.query: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/
questions.explanation:
To attract users, we included:
* A rewards and referral system
* Additional scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population
* A marketing campaign focused on Sierra Leone

questions.query: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.
questions.explanation:
* Milestone 1: 3600
* Milestone 2: 1200
* Milestone 3: 1200
* Milestone 4: 1200
* Milestone 5: 1700

In case we receive less we will advance as much as we can in each milestone with priority to milestone 1.

questions.query: Ecosystem Contribution: How does your project complement existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem rather than competing with them?
questions.explanation: We are not aware of any learning platform with a course on (1) GoodDollar, (2) conversion to stablecoins, and (3) with rewards, a referral system, and scholarships for the Sierra Leonean population.

questions.query: Ethical Compliance: Confirm you have read and will comply with the ethical standards outlined in the eligibility criteria.
Additional Info: Is there anything else critical for evaluating your project that wasn't covered in the questions above?
questions.explanation: As part of the scout game we  have contributed PR that resolved issues in the GoodCollective repository and we expect that the reward will be for this project. See https://github.com/GoodDollar/GoodCollective/pull/291 and https://github.com/GoodDollar/GoodCollective/pull/293 We plan to continue.
